What is Forex

The foreign exchange market is the largest and most liquid market in the world, and open 24 hours a day, 5 days a week, with more than $4 trillion in daily trading volume, more than any exchange-based market.

Forex trading involves trading one currency pair against another, predicting the rise or fall of one currency against another. Currencies are traded in pairs, such as the euro against the U.S. dollar (EUR/USD).

Forex Trading Examples

BACKGROUND INFORMATION

CURRENCY PAIR

Buy EUR/Sell USD

OPENING PRICE

1.18508

TRADE SIZE(LOTS)

1

LEVERAGE

30:1

You decide to buy €100,000, the leverage on your trading account is 1:30. Therefore the margin required to open the position is (€100,000 x 1.18508) = USD $118,508/30 = USD $3,950.26.

Trading Profit

The price rises to 1.18823.

You decide to close the long trade by selling at 1.18823 (the current sell price).

CLOSING PRICE

1.18823

GROSS PROFIT ON TRADE

€100,000 * (1.18823-1.18508) = USD $315

Trading Losses

The price falls to 1.18193.

You decide to close the long trade by selling at 1.18193 (the current sell price).

CLOSING PRICE

1.18193

Loss Profit on Trade

€100,000 * (1.18193-1.18508)= USD $-315
